bibl.title: Military Orders for Aristides Agramonte, May 21, 1901

div1.p: Special Orders #118 relieves Agramonte from duty as a member of the board of medical officers investigating infectious diseases. He is ordered to report to the commanding general, Department of Cuba, for assignment to duty.

div1.head: Military Orders for Aristides Agramonte, May 21, 1901
div1.p:
HEADQUARTERS OF THE ARMY,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, May 21, 1901.

28. By direction of the Secretary of War, Contract Surgeon
Aristides Agramonte, U. S. Army, is relieved from further
duty as a member of the board of medical officers appointed
by paragraph 34, Special Orders, No. 122, May 24, 1900, from
this office, for the purpose of pursuing scientific investigations
with reference to the infectious diseases prevalent in the island
of Cuba, and will report in person to the commanding general,
Department of Cuba, for assignment to duty.
BY COMMAND OF LIEUTENANT GENERAL MILES:

H. C. CORBIN,
Adjutant General,
Major General, U. S. Army.
